summary: Orpheus was a legendary musician, poet, and prophet in Greek mythology. He is known for his ability to charm all living things with his music and for his journey to the underworld to bring back his wife, Eurydice. Ancient Greek authors like Strabo and Plutarch wrote about Orpheus, and he is considered one of the most significant figures in Western culture, with his story appearing in many forms of art. Orpheus was also a founder of the "Orphic" mysteries and was believed to have composed several important works, including the Orphic Hymns and the Orphic Argonautica.
title: Orpheus
